intro: Sabia javanica var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth sabia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
